I know that adobe owns it and its been renamed and changed a bit, but thats=
 why I said I use cool edit pro (2) from before because I prefer it the way=
 it was, it works perfect for what I do with recordings..etc and no I wasnt=
 thinking of sound forge, I have sony acid pro 6. Anyway you are right thou=
gh use either the old cool edit pro (which I do) or audition for evp's. Aci=
d pro is not the way to go for editting recordings searching for evps. 

--=

Sony Sound Forge is =
the audio program you are probably thinking of..=A0=A0 As far as cool edit-=
 Adobe owns it now.. now it is called Adobe Audition.=A0 I have used all 3 =
and by far prefer Auditon..=A0 but I am an Adobe snob and tend to prefer al=
l Adobe products.
=A0

: Re: [EVP-ITC] Acid Pro








I have sony acid pro 6, I use it for loop =
creation for a website Im working on currently and for a track for a animat=
ed video Im doing for the intro to my site (that Im doing in 3d studio max =
9). As far as I can tell sony acid pro is really not a program you'd want t=
o use for evp related things, I mean you can but you are over complicating =
what you want to be doing. What I use for evp's is cool edit pro. I dont be=
lieve the new company that took it over calls it cool edit pro any longer b=
ut, I use the older version because it works great for evp's, so if you goo=
gle it you can find it no problem, it makes it easier to strip out ambient =
noise (like white noise) while leaving the voices completely entact. its ba=
sically like diving deeper and deeper into the sound and it works great for=
 it. Regards,

<DIV><FONT face=Arial size=2>Sony Sound Forge is the audio program you are probably thinking of..   As far as cool edit- Adobe owns it now.. now it is called Adobe Audition.  I have used all 3 and by far prefer Auditon..  but I am an Adobe snob and tend to prefer all Adobe products.</FONT></DIV>

<DIV style="BACKGROUND: #e4e4e4; FONT: 10pt arial"><B>From:</B> <A title=vampire2kd@... href="mailto:vampire2kd@..." target=_blank rel=nofollow>Saklitaboth</A> </DIV>
<DIV style="FONT: 10pt arial"><B>To:</B> <A title=EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com href="mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com" target=_blank rel=nofollow>EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com</A> </DIV>

<DIV id=ygrp-text>
<P>
<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>
<TBODY>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top>
<P>I have sony acid pro 6, I use it for loop creation for a website Im working on currently and for a track for a animated video Im doing for the intro to my site (that Im doing in 3d studio max 9). As far as I can tell sony acid pro is really not a program you'd want to use for evp related things, I mean you can but you are over complicating what you want to be doing. What I use for evp's is cool edit pro. I dont believe the new company that took it over calls it cool edit pro any longer but, I use the older version because it works great for evp's, so if you google it you can find it no problem, it makes it easier to strip out ambient noise (like white noise) while leaving the voices completely entact. its basically like diving deeper and deeper into the sound and it works great for it. Regards,</P>
<P>                                                                                T.L.<BR><BR>--- On <B>Tue, 7/8/08, Zack Widup <I><w9sz@prairienet. org></I></B> wrote:<BR></P>
<BLOCKQUOTE style="BORDER-LEFT: rgb(16,16,255) 2px solid">From: Zack Widup <w9sz@prairienet. org><BR>Subject: [EVP-ITC] Acid Pro<BR>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com<BR>Date: Tuesday, July 8, 2008, 11:16 AM<BR><BR><PRE>Yep - here it is:

http://www.sonycrea tivesoftware. com/acidpro

I think I'll try the free demo.

Zack
